description: From the verb phrase lay away.

entries.meaning: (tanning) A pit in which hides are stored.
(Canada, US) The system of accepting a deposit and holding for a customer to complete purchase.
examples: A chain of local gun shops advertised, as a “Father's Day Sale,” the semiautomatic Intratec TEC-9, with extra ammo clip, case, and flash suppressor, reduced from $347.80 to $249.95 and available on layaway.

entries.meaning: (Canada, US) An item which has been held in this way.

verbs.description: layaway (third-person singular simple present layaways, present participle layawaying, simple past and past participle layawayed)

entries.meaning: To place items on hold with a deposit at a merchant's.
